title.narrative: Feasibility study Polder roof New York City

description.narrative: • Short general project overviewThe aim of the feasibility study was to analyse the market opportunities and challenges for the Polder Roof concept. The year-long study consisted of four visits, over one hundred and twenty interviews, the creation of over eighty strong industry contacts, enrolling in a local consortium and partnership creation with local beneficiaries supported by letters of intent.• What makes the technology, product, method or approach used innovativeBuilding on over ten years of experience in the Dutch green roof industry, MetroPolder saw a disconnect in the way cities were treating rainwater, and conversely ignoring the true potential of rooftops. By installing and IOT controller and smart valve, the Polder Roof effectively monitors and adapts to weather forecasting and seasonal impacts in real-time. The impact is the elimination of effluent contribution to the sewer system from the roof, and the re-purposing of rainwater for biodiverse, cooling, natural systems. The Polder Roof technology creates a smart grid for rainwater and can be thought of as the evolution of GreenRoof 2.0• What are the results of the projectThe New York City market is favourable; In the last two years, the city has steadily grown from the 9th to the 3rd largest installer of green roof systems per capita in the United States. The Polder Roof outperforms the competition; compared to a typical green roof the Polder Roof provides more water storage, building cooling, biodiversity, and weighs less. An extensive cost comparison found that the Polder Roof is only marginally more expensive on average per square foot, while it is significantly less expensive than traditional underground building water storage and provides 99% stormwater capture during events which overwhelm city stormwater infrastructure. Combined with a favourable political climate in the city and a welcoming community, the potential for taking a next step in terms of a pilot project was underlined through this feasibility study.
